Sales Service¶

Sales.routes.create_sale()[source]¶

Create a sale transaction.

This route performs the following operations: - Validates request data. - Deducts the total price from the customer’s wallet. - Updates the inventory count for the sold item. - Records the sale in the database.

Request body:

JSON object containing: - customer_username (str): Username of the customer (required). - item_name (str): Name of the item to be sold (required). - quantity (int): Quantity of the item to be sold (required).

Returns:

JSON object with the sale confirmation or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Sales.routes.get_good_details(good_name)[source]¶

Retrieve details of a specific good from the Inventory Service.

good_name (str) – Name of the good to fetch details for.

Returns:

JSON object containing the item’s details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Sales.routes.get_goods()[source]¶

Retrieve all available goods from the Inventory Service.

This route fetches goods with positive stock counts from the Inventory Service.

Returns:

JSON object containing a list of goods or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Sales.routes.get_purchase_history(username)[source]¶

Retrieve purchase history for a specific customer.

Fetches a list of all purchases made by a customer.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username of the customer.

Returns:

JSON object containing the purchase history or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Sales.routes.health_check()[source]¶

Health check endpoint.

This route checks the health of the sales service, including: - Database connectivity. - Health of external services (Inventory Service and Customer Service).

Returns:

JSON object indicating the health status of the database and external services.

Return type:

flask.Response
